tasks.name: n-back task
tasks.definition: A letter variant of the n-back task paradigm in which three n-back blocks ranging from 0-back to 2-back interleaved with four fixation blocks (F). Participants were required to press a button with their right index finger on the appearance of the letter Z in a string of letters (0-back), or whenever the current letter was identical to the letter right before (1-back), or the letter two spaces before (2-back).
